description:
BaseWallet.invoke(address,uint256,bytes) (wallet/BaseWallet.sol#126-137) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- (success,_result) = _target.call{value: _value}(_data) (wallet/BaseWallet.sol#128)
markdown:
[BaseWallet.invoke(address,uint256,bytes)](contracts/wallet/BaseWallet.sol#L126-L137) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- [(success,_result) = _target.call{value: _value}(_data)](contracts/wallet/BaseWallet.sol#L128)

description:
Contract locking ether found in :
	Contract Proxy (wallet/Proxy.sol#25-52) has payable functions:
	 - Proxy.fallback() (wallet/Proxy.sol#35-46)
	 - Proxy.receive() (wallet/Proxy.sol#48-50)
	But does not have a function to withdraw the ether
markdown:
Contract locking ether found in :
	Contract [Proxy](contracts/wallet/Proxy.sol#L25-L52) has payable functions:
	 - [Proxy.fallback()](contracts/wallet/Proxy.sol#L35-L46)
	 - [Proxy.receive()](contracts/wallet/Proxy.sol#L48-L50)
	But does not have a function to withdraw the ether

description:

	 - BaseWallet.receive() (wallet/BaseWallet.sol#162-163)
	But does not have a function to withdraw the ether
